title: Zealot's robes

properties.name: description
properties.value: Zealot's robes are a set of robes that provides a 1.25% chance per piece to prevent bones or ensouled heads from being consumed whilst training Prayer – totalling 5% with the full set equipped. This bonus stacks multiplicatively with the bone-saving effect of the Chaos Temple altar. The effect does not apply when consuming bones with Sinister Offering.

content:
A player wearing the Zealot's robes.

Zealot's robes are a set of robes that provides a 1.25% chance per piece to prevent bones or ensouled heads from being consumed whilst training Prayer – totalling 5% with the full set equipped. This bonus stacks multiplicatively with the bone-saving effect of the Chaos Temple altar. The effect does not apply when consuming bones with Sinister Offering.

Pieces of the zealot's robes are obtained from looting gold chests within the Shade Catacombs, each has a 1/128 chance of giving a piece of the set, no duplicates will be given until a full set is already obtained. On average, 512 gold keys are required to obtain the full set, which requires approximately 648 Urium remains or 3,273 Fiyr remains. The entire set can be stored in a magic wardrobe in a player-owned house costume room.

Zealot's robes do not count as Saradomin items in the God Wars Dungeon, even though the top and bottom have a similar appearance to Monk's robes.

These robes have the same weight as Monk's robes, but with +1 Prayer bonus. The zealot's robe bottom is tied with proselyte cuisse for best-in-slot Prayer bonus in the leg slot.

Components[edit | edit source]

Item Chance to save
Zealot's helm 1.25%
Zealot's robe top 1.25%
Zealot's robe bottom 1.25%
Zealot's boots 1.25%
Full set 5.0%

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
30 June 2021
(update | poll)

Zealot's robes now provide prayer bonuses.

24 March 2021
(update)

The value of zealot's robes has been further increased.

17 March 2021
(update)

The value of zealot's robes has increased to protect over all bones upon death.

24 February 2021
(update)

Zealot's robes now gives players a chance to save ensouled heads when casting reanimation spells.

rawContent:
[[File:Zealot's robes equipped.png|thumb|120px|A player wearing the Zealot's robes.]]
'''Zealot's robes''' are a set of robes that provides a 1.25% chance per piece to prevent [[Remains#Bones|bones]] or [[ensouled head]]s from being consumed whilst training [[Prayer]] – totalling 5% with the full set equipped. This bonus stacks multiplicatively with the bone-saving effect of the [[Chaos Temple (hut)|Chaos Temple]] altar. The effect does not apply when consuming bones with [[Sinister Offering]].

Pieces of the zealot's robes are obtained from looting [[gold chest]]s within the [[Shade Catacombs]], each has a 1/128 chance of giving a piece of the set, no duplicates will be given until a full set is already obtained. On average, 512 gold keys are required to obtain the full set, which requires approximately 648 [[Urium remains]] or 3,273 [[Fiyr remains]]. The entire set can be stored in a [[Magic wardrobe space|magic wardrobe]] in a [[player-owned house]] [[costume room]].

Zealot's robes '''do not''' count as [[Saradomin]] items in the [[God Wars Dungeon]], even though the top and bottom have a similar appearance to [[Monk's robes]].

These robes have the same weight as [[Monk's robes]], but with +1 [[Prayer bonus]]. The [[zealot's robe bottom]] is tied with [[proselyte cuisse]] for best-in-slot Prayer bonus in the leg slot.
